poem:
Title: The Dance of the Fiscal Fight

Man of Mint, Sunak, set for the fight,
In the cruel political night.
"Axe for the tax," the Tories' tune,
To be hummed under the fiscal moon.
Labour leads, the press does tell,
But prime minister rings freedom's bell,
"We'll cut, when time permits to do,
Reward for those who slog and hew." 
In this, our brittle, money plight,
Sunak vows, he's up for the fight.
